name: Residence Inn Chicago Downtown / River North

reviews.text: Went for the weekend with my 78 year old mom and my husband. We needed a suite hotel and this fit the bill. The free breakfast was very good. Not gourmet, but lots of healthy options. The 24 hour coffee bar in the lobby was also a great perk. The room was nice and having a large refrigerator was great. If I needed a suite, I would stay again. Also, good location.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Stayed for two nights for business in October 2011. Location was great, rooms were clean, fitness facility was solid and the staff was quite helpful.
reviews.title: Great stay in River North!

reviews.text: Will return on future trips to Chicago.
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: I do not have one bad thing to say about our stay here. Probably the only tthing close to a complaint is the elevators can take a while sometimes. The hotel is centrally located. we took the Blue Line from O'Hara and only walked a few blocks. We were also able to catch the CTA buses close by. Lots of eats close by too. We were here for the marathon and were able to get around town just fine.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay!

reviews.text: One exceptional point sounds a bit goofy, but the lady that is in charge of the breakfast here is awesome! there is plenty of good food and she says hi to literally everyone in this busy dining area. The hotel also hosts happy hours regularly with food and beverages. Could very well substitute for a dinner in most cases.
reviews.title: Ismeta is phenomenal

reviews.text: I stayed 5 nights on a recent business trip and was simply wowed by everything about this hotel, from the genuinely friendly service to the great amenities. This will be my first choice for visiting Chicago.
reviews.title: A JEWEL OF RIVER NORTH

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Gold Marriott- Ignored

reviews.text: -ISMETA: wonder woman/supermom of breakfast service. Simply have never seen anyone as friendly, helpful, and genuinely kind working in a hotel. Can she be cloned? In fairness, all employees that I encountered here were very friendly.
reviews.title: Nice staff makes you feel very welcome

reviews.text: -breakfast and "light" dinner food. The oatmeal, eggs, and potato "pancakes" were wonderful. At dinner (M-Th), the rotating menu was substantial enough so I didn't have to go out for a real dinner. One night was great split pea soup and the next was lasagna. They also serve soda, beer, and wine--all complimentary!
reviews.title: Great Time in Chicago

reviews.text: -location: 2 blocks from the Blue line (Lake and Clark) or 3 blocks from the Red line (Grand and State) CTA trains. No need for a shuttle from O'Hare, unless you have a lot of luggage. Great restaurants within easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Location and Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 2 nights at this hotel; our first stay at a Residence Inn. As we were checking in, I mentioned the positive reviews on tripadvisor. Shortly after, we were advised that we were the “Guests of the Day” and were presented with a nice goodie bag.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Chicago

reviews.text: This hotel does a business with long-term guests and the rooms are designed to accommodate their needs. I think that you could be very comfortable staying at this hotel for an extended stay. The room was spacious and had a very comfortable King Size Bed. Although we did not use them, the stovetop, microwave and refrigerator could come in handy for those staying in Chicago for longer periods.
reviews.title: Simply fantastic.

reviews.text: We used the hotel as a base for exploring Chicago. It’s in a very convenient location and served our needs perfectly. On arrival day, we walked up Michigan Ave. and took the train up to Wrigleyville to catch a Cubs game. With our one full day in town, we walked to Buckingham Fountain and then back up to Oak Beach. On our departure day, we walked to the Gold Coast and Old Town areas.
reviews.title: Great location, great breakfast hostess, TERRIBLE sofa bed

reviews.text: The included breakfast was probably the best that we’ve ever had. As mentioned, the plus was the service provided by Ismeta. She greeted every guest and offered to make a waffle for my wife (that’s usually a DIY). She is truly an asset.
reviews.title: Not all rooms are created equal...

reviews.text: I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: A great place with a great breakfast hostess

reviews.text: We stayed here with 2 dogs and our 2 year old. It was great. The staff was so friendly! It was stylish, very clean and roomy. We had a one bedroom that had every thing we needed! They were so nice to our dogs. There was also a great free breakfast evey morning. The only bad part was the parking. We had a trailer and suv. It was going to be $160 for 2 nights parking. We parked 3 blocks away and still payed $120.
reviews.title: Great place for animals!!

reviews.text: We go to Chicago for family weekends several times a year and have stayed at many of the "best" hotels along Michigan avenue. This trip we were scrambling to find a hotel room for Friday and Saturday nights on Friday afternoon. We stumbled upon this residence inn with great ratings on trip advisor and a very good nightly rate so we decided to give it a try. I can promise that this will be our new home base in the Chicago area. I want to start by saying that Ismeta, who runs the breakfast area, absolutely made our day with her breakfast! We felt like personal friends of hers and she went out of her way to take care of us! (Yes, we only met her on Saturday morning!!!) The whole hotel had a friendly vibe, from the front desk to the doorman! The location was great for walking to all the great shopping and tourist areas along Miracle Mile, and a great location for finding new restaurants! Our room was very clean and felt new. I was pleased that there was plenty of hot water for our family showers and I felt like this hotel was quieter than many we have stayed at in this area. We will definitely return to this Residence Inn!
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great location and value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Residence Inn Chicago River North is a great value. Excellent location near Mich Ave shops and near north restaurants & bars.
reviews.title: Res Inn Excellent Location

reviews.text: Had a one day layover for a connecting AMTRAK trip to Florida, and staying at this property, among the numerous hotels in the area, was a perfect choice. Location on Dearborn is close to everything......Navy Pier is a bit of a walk - but, shopping, tours, and food are all close by.
reviews.title: Center of Chicago's North End - Excellent Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Property is maintained very well (looks brand new). Elevators are fast, rooms are spacious. There is a supermarket and 7-11 nearby to stock up the kitchen in the room. Breakfast *is* included, and very nice. The staff is very friendly (yes, friendly in Chicago) - esp Michael and Katie at the front desk (I requested a late check-out, due to the late departure of my train, and they eagerly accomodated my request). Fitness, Pool and Laundry are on the 27th floor, so you have a nice view while you are up there.
reviews.title: Our new favorite hotel in Chicago

aka: Residence Inn Chicago Downtown / River North Hotel Chicago
description: The Residence Inn Chicago Downtown River North is located just north of the Loop and surrounded by art and antique galleries, boutiques, and a variety of dining options. It is steps from world-class shopping on Chicago's "Mag Mile," and convenient to North Ave Beach, Navy Pier, Millennium Park, and Lincoln Park Zoo. The hotel offers a complimentary buffet and weeknight Manager's Reception, high-speed Internet Access, an indoor pool, and fitness room.
